intro: Clidemia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has slender, often hairy stems and small, ovate leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. It typically grows on the branches of trees, drawing moisture and nutrients from its host. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject in ecological and botanical studies.
